content: Very nice game
Allright

I love the game. Real physics and fun. Instead of new models of small sailboats, I wish you could customize hull and sail. The colors are okay for sails. It would be best if you could choose. An example is the ai boats. The Pirate one in nice, would love to have that hull and sail as something for the player. If you had that along with custom tracks, it would last forever. A great buy, just would love to see more customization in the boats. Thanks.
replyContent: Thank you for the review! We are working on a number of new features (more boats, maps, multiplayer, VR, etc.), and boat customization is almost ready (adding custom labels on sails and hull, adjusting colors). These will likely be paid options in the $1-$5 range. Unfortunately we are extremely busy these days so the release will take some time...

content: Took my money and wouldn't install
replyContent: "Wouldn't install" does not depend on the app itself, but on your device. Maybe you have no space (free memory, free storage) left? What exactly happened? Did you see any error message? Also, you may always get a refund in such cases.

content: Very interesting game. not a sailor but did a bit as a kid. Would love to give it another go as an adult. This game has just convinced me that I need to look into this abit more. The controls are a little awkward but that's more to do with it being on a phone not the controls themselves. Ye I like it. Maybe in the future add other types of small sailing boats from amateur to pro. But that's just a suggestion. The game as it is the best I've played. Not many modes but for the price its spot on
replyContent: We are glad you like the game! And yes, we are working on a number of new features ‚Äì more boats, more tracks, boat customization, multiplayer, VR, and others. It will take time but hopefully they will arrive :-) Have a look at "Random track" feature for customized, variable tracks, and see free "Yoles Martinique" game to try a very different boat.

content: As a sailer, its is a great app for practicing wind directions. Physics works good. But i realy miss two things: - optional speed meter - user interface. Its really hard to stear when u have to use the whole botom width of phone, specialy in landscape. Wold be nice to have a small jojstic aside.
replyContent: ‚¨§ "Speed meter" ‚Äì activate in Settings: Display, scroll down down to advanced, select "Display boat speed and force". ‚¨§ Steering ‚Äì instead of the slider at the bottom of the screen, tilt your phone left/right like a car steering wheel. Or you may try to use a separate hardware Bluetooth joystick ‚Äì it may work depending on your Android version.

content: Too muvh changing in your of courses
replyContent: Not sure what you mean, but use Custom Track to adjust the conditions to your liking.

content: Non sailor curious about how boats use wind & sail. Loving the app so far.
Great sail boat simulator

userName: just a guy that was bored
content: As a sailor I think (especially when it's high winds) that the physycs and attributes are super realistic, especially I love the racing where there is correct physycs with craching and beachinf
replyContent: Thanks! Regarding a sandbox ‚Äì read about "Free sailing mode" in Help and you will find the way to "just sail" :-)

content: As a sailor, I quite enjoyed the game's realism and it is definitely a must-have for anyone who enjoys sailing. (There are more realistic simulators on pc but for a much higher price) The graqhics are pretty good except for the character models which are, to be honest, quite ugly. Unfortunately there are not many levels but the random level creator should keep people busy.

Gameplay is about as good as it can be for a realistic sim but the graphics have artifacts (triangular, extending from the boat back to major background objects) that appear to be connected to reflectivity since that's the only display control that affects them. Galaxy Tab A 2016. Otherwise I'd rate it 5 across the board Its now 6 months later - first time I tried it since then and the developer says its fixed. All good now. Definitely rates 5 stars now. Wish there were more developers like this
replyContent: Fixed in version 7.2, please verify.

content: Great game. seems you have fixed the sail training bug in this but not in the yoles one. i still think you need to update physics to be more realistic like your other simulator as I grew up sailing small dinghies and none of them reacted to helming the way this does, eg when you gybe the boat shouldn't slow down that much, also should be able to surf waves. the other problem is the AI, as soon as you go to overtake one to leeward, they turn into you and gives you a massive penalty.
replyContent: Hello Rob, 1) Are you sure you need to repeat the tutorials in the same app? Maybe it was confusing because you have both Top Sailor and Yoles Martinique installed, and both have almost identical tutorials? 2) The physics in both games is different because both use very different boats. Yoles are much heavier, more inert, faster, with larger sails.

content: Love this app as it helped to drive home the sailing essentials and get you thinking about your sailing plan.
replyContent: We are glad the simulator is useful for you, thanks!

content: Fun simple sailing game.... that the wind keeps changing on with no rhyme or reason. ü§®
replyContent: On some tracks the wind is more stable, on others the wind is more variable. You can customize your track and select the wind type you like.

content:
I am new to sailing, and got the bug to give it a shot.. this sim seems to 
me to give quite a good taste of the correct techniques to handling an 
actual sailboat. Quite a fun sim too, well done!!
used to be great, but since i upgrade to galaxy s8Ôºåthe graphic doesnt display properly.
replyContent: Fixed in version 7.2, please verify.

content: This game is really impressive, but needs a little tweaking.  The steering, whether by tilting or using the slider, is very sluggish.  The capsize mechanism, however, is way too sensitive.  Those combine to dump you in the water way too frequently.  Another annoyance is that the start of every race faces you away from the start line, and you can't turn towards it until you trim you still which many times causes you to capsize because your can't steer!  Annoying as hell!  I would love to play this game more, but I can't stand to touch it until that's fixed.  I'll give it 4 stars and check back now and then to see if it's fixed.  ASA's sailing app has much more realistic boat control, but it's basically a training app.  Combine the realism of that app and the competition of this one and you'd have a winner!

It's a great game, good physics, good visuals, good sound. Hasn't been updated for a while and the camera jumps around if you miss the tiller and sail controls, a setting to disable this would be nice. It's the best sailing game I've found.
Love it played it for several years now. Could do with a few more courses.
2 problems on Galaxy s6: water turns white in certain angles and 3 distorted polygons for the far corners of the viewport meet at the top of the bow.  I will change my rating when this gets fixes.
replyContent: Fixed in version 7.2, please verify.

content: learning to sail with this app helps

I'm learning to sail and this app helped me understand points of sail in ways a textbook could not. It gave me more confidence to head out on the water solo. And just last week I earned my Basic Sailor rating!
replyContent: Wow, good to hear and congratulations! :-)

content: I love this app and don't get bored of it. Great to play on the train on the way home. Some issues with image breaking down or blowing out on my Samsung 6, where the seas and sky go white. Not sure what's causing it but I have tried every resolution setting.  I think this game could really be a winner if you develop it for Gear VR. I think we need a sailing game where you can turn your head to see what is happening around you and to view a line around a race marker. Even better if you can develop a way to feel the wind direction on your face. Well done. Great app.
replyContent: Thank you for your kind words. We have finally found a device where we could reproduce the "white water" problem, and we fixed this problem! Definitely, full 3D/VR would be great and this is in our plans, to support new ways of interaction when they become popular and available to average users.

content: I think the game is great and is good fun, but when you create your own race, you rarely ever get a beat, maybe another feature could be having a set wind direction and set a beat in there. Also, having a, let's say, 30s countdown to a start would be great so everyone starts together, and having a start on the beat would be even better but overall, it's a great game!!
replyContent: We decided to avoid the "synchronized start" approach because then it became crowded and quite difficult to sail; especially for newbie players it was impossible to navigate among many sailboats without collisions. Thank you for your kind words, glad you like the game!

content: Everything I touch takes it to the menu.....waste of money
replyContent: Then use the menu to start a game. And explore the menu before writing your review, you will find a lot of options there.

content: Feels like sailing a Laser dinghy, very impressed! Beautiful graphics and intuitive controls (I prefer the on-screen tiller and main sheet control to the tilt sensor though)
Fantastic game, good graphics and fun to play.
Love it
Fantastic game great fun
It's the best sailing Sim I found.
You really do get the feel of sailing.
Great game
Keep crashing on my Toshiba thrive
replyContent: Fixed in version 7.2, please verify.

content: I have some experience sailing real dinghies and this game is pretty realistic and has the right feel.   Is it a bug or just me not getting something, but the "Follow yacht - locked" camera mode doesn't seem to do anything different than the unlocked mode. If I move the camera in locked mode, it moves and stays on the altered view angle after moving. Ideally IMO the locked view should allow you to look around, but automatically snap back to the default "Follow yacht" angle when you lift your finger off the screen.  EDIT: Thanks, return to default view could be faster so you don't lose precious time if you accidentally move the camera. But it's still a great game!
replyContent: Camera modes were improved in version 7.2, please verify.

content: Great game/simulator. It needs more boat models, like single sail ancient & race boats & other bigger boats
replyContent: More boats will be coming :-) In the mean time, have a look at the "Yoles Martinique" game.

content: Love it if I could just stop accidentally changing the view.  Being able to lock in the view would prevent the frequently frustrating and game costing view changes.
replyContent: Camera work has been improved in version 7.2, please verify.

content: SD Card install option would be good.
Great game.  Awesome graphics. Money well spent.
Fun, good looking game, but tilt controls don't work on Xperia Z1 since KitKat update. Dev was responsive, but says it's Sony's problem. Guess I just have to wait and see.
replyContent: Any news on Top Sailor and your current device?

content: I like this game. Don't you guys thinking about multiplayer feature?
replyContent: We are! "More tracks" will be the next feature though.

content: Great little dinghy game
Suggest to have online score records.
replyContent: It is on our "to do" list, thanks!

content: Waste of money unless you are going to play for hours to get the extremely finicky controls down. Controls are simple in theory but there is a razor thin margin from non-performance to capsized. Wind is much too random. Courses are far too small to allow decent tacking maneuvers with islands placed to utterly destroy any reasonable lines to the gates. The graphics are great which sucks you in since the demo doesn't let you experience the poor actual game play.
replyContent: The courses are as long as to allow one to complete them in 3-5 minutes, which is the time most people are willing to spend on a single race (and this is different from real life sailing). Use the "custom track" option to adjust track properties like length, islands and wind. As to the controls... hard to make them simpler, tilt the device to turn.

content: Yes
Excellent game works great on my HTC1v good graphics good gameplay online mode would be cool though also dont work on nexus 7 minis a Star
This is great for passing the time when there's no wind out in the real world

Really good sailing/racing simulator...opponents and a free sail mode...really uses Android's 3D capabilites...A couple of minor improvements I'll suggest - really locking the screen during a race...more later...
Good game overall, but wind  shifts are unrealistic.

userName: Sir Puppybone Pawprint K9 Red Bloodhound Hound Dog
content: It's very cool that you can play it in 3D though, if you have a pair laying around, so kudos to the devs for that! I've only tried it without the glasses so far though, since I don't have a pair right now, so I can't review the 3D yet. As for the rest of the game, it's certainly among the best sailing simulators available for Android right now, even without the bonus 3D mode. It's not the most realistic, but it's not the most simplistic either, so it's well balanced. Not too easy, not too hard!

I've tried the demo and the paid version and although the Google store says my Note II is compatible, once the download completes I don't see either app.   I have to give this 1 star until I can actually play it!
replyContent: James, if you don't see the app icon then it has nothing to do with the app itself. I would suggest checking if you have enough free memory, and other system-wide settings related to Google play store and installing apps. The web gives various reasons for the "missing icon" problem, and as far as I can see, all of them are device/user-related.

Great game/sim!

content: Excellent
Good game great graphics. However not being a sailor its a little tough getting started.
replyContent: ...because sailing is not that super simple, but we are trying to make learning attractive and easy for non-sailors! :)

content: What a great game but it completely crashes my note 2. I have to remove the battery to unbrick it. I got this new phone a few months ago and my paid version is a big problem! Dev, please find a fix for the note 2 for a paying customer! I was really expecting this game to be awesome on my large screen.
replyContent: Thanks for reporting and please check your email box for an answer. Also, verify if version 7.2 works well for you.

content: I love this game. The graphics and attention to detail are excellent. If you fall out of the boat then the little guy will swim back and climb in and he even turns his head to look when another boat comes along side. What is infuriating though is if you get hit by another boat and its not your fault, you still get penalised. Your score gets hammered too if you dont come first but creeps up when you do! Thats sailing I guess. Look forward to future add ons etc. Samsung Tab 10.1
great graph, control and simulation
Amazing game!
I think the controls are pretty good, steering and trim are alright.  But the courses and wind conditions seem ridiculous, nothing like any real races. I've been racing sailboats for over 40 years.
replyContent: The game is tailored to a mobile device and typical conditions when a mobile device is used. Thus races are much shorter (in time and length) than in the real world, and winds are more variable. The emphasis is on learning basics of sailing on a small screen, so in this regard it is not like sitting in a real sailboat in a real race.

content: Very happy with this. Can we get a catamaran?
Awesome graphics.  Great sound.  Realistic physics.
Freezes after 2 min gameplay then restart, then freezes again. Restart. Freeze, restar-freeze, r-f, r-f-rffrfrfrfrfr. Too bad.. sorry
replyContent: Fixed in version 7.2, please verify.

content: Surprisingly realistic sailing theory simulator. Of course, there always could be some improvements - like wind could be less visible and boats leaning could be more impeding for visual comprehending of situation (that would make it even more realistic), but then again it's only a phone game, not a substitute for a serious sailing theory and practice. Usable fun.

Don't use the onscreen tiller! Tilt the phone to steer and you'll start having fun. Keeps me coming back for more! I wrote the developer about the Nexus 7 issue and got a nice response the next day. Despite running the simulator to check that the app would run ok it still has problems. On an HTC one X the app crashes after one race after returning to the race selection menu. The water animation frequently disappears and there's no indication of boat speed when racing.

content: Very true to life. Capsising. Waves. Keeling over. Sensible computer controlled boats. Challenging.  Just like a real dingy. So much detail even masts snap.!
